page.title: 02Ecology
page.content: The nature of the land is low-lying; nowhere is it elevated above 10 metres above sea-level. It is the flood plain of the tidal{River Ouse.}The land has been improved through electical pumping, and artificial flood banks have enabled the area to be used for intensive arable farming. Settlements tend to follow the higher natural features such as river cliffs. There is concern about the effects of extensive development in the area and efforts are being made to provide conservation areas. Its position at the bottom of the{Vale {of York}protects this area from some of the extremes of British climate. The proximity of the area to the{Power {Stations of Drax and Eggborough}is a source of concern in relation to the problems of pollution.
